info.title: OPERA Cloud Activity Management API
info.description:
APIs to cater for Activity Configuration functionality in OPERA Cloud. In this module you can retrieve, create, update Activity configuration codes, for example create a new Activity Type.

Compatible with OPERA Cloud release 24.4.

This document and all content within is available under the Universal Permissive License v 1.0 (https://oss.oracle.com/licenses/upl). Copyright (c) 2020, 2024 Oracle and/or its affiliates.

get.summary: Get all Configured Activity Result Codes
get.description:
Retrieve a list of all configured Activity Result codes and descriptions. Activity Results appear on the Activities screen in the Results field after the Activity is completed. And example could be Call Again - an activity is Completed but the result code as part of the completion is to Call Again.

OperationId:getActivityResultsConfig

The maximum allowable limit for this API is 25.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

parameters.name: fetchInactive
parameters.description: Determines wether to fetch inactive records or not.

parameters.name: codes
parameters.description: Codes to be searched.

parameters.name: wildCard
parameters.description: Wildcard search on the code.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the code.

200.description: Response object for fetching configured Activity Results.

post.description:
Create a new Activity Results Code, for example SUCCESS, END, CALLAGAIN. These codes are used when you complete an activity. You need to specify an Activity Result Code as part of that completion process.

OperationId:postActivityResultsConfig

parameters.name: activityResultsConfigInfo
parameters.description: Request object for creating Activity Results Configuration.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

delete.description:
Delete an Activity Result Code from OPERA Cloud.

OperationId:deleteActivityResultsConfig

parameters.name: activityResultCode
parameters.description: Activity Result Code.

200.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

put.description:
Change or update details of an existing Activity Results Code.

OperationId:putActivityResultsConfig

parameters.name: activityResultCode
parameters.description: Activity Result Code.

parameters.name: activityResultsConfigInfo
parameters.description: Request object for changing Activity Results Configuration.

get.description:
Retrieve a list of all configured Auto Trace Codes for a property.

OperationId:getAutoTraceCodes

The maximum allowable limit for this API is 25.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

parameters.name: autoTraceGroups
parameters.description: A collection of supported list of Auto Trace Groups.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description for the Trace Code to be searched for.

200.description: Response object to fetch Auto Trace Codes.

parameters.name: autoTraceCodesInfo
parameters.description: Request object for creating Auto Trace Codes.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

parameters.name: autoTraceCode
parameters.description: Unique code of trace.

200.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

parameters.name: autoTraceCode
parameters.description: Unique code of trace.

parameters.name: autoTraceCodesInfo
parameters.description: Request object for changing Auto Trace Codes.

delete.summary: Delete an Auto Trace definitions Code
delete.description:
Delete an Auto trace definition code.

OperationId:deleteAutoTraceDefinitions

parameters.name: autoTraceDefinitionId
parameters.description: Unique ID of trace.

200.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

delete.summary: Delete an Auto Trace owner assignment
delete.description:
Delete a Trace owner assignment configured for a property.

OperationId:deleteAutoTraceOwnerAssignments

parameters.name: autoTraceOwnerAssignmentID
parameters.description: Unique ID of trace owner.

200.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

post.description:
With this API you can select existing Activity Type Codes from the source property and copy them to another (target) property.

OperationId:copyActivityTypesConfig

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the source hotel.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

post.summary: Copy an Auto Trace definition Code
post.description:
Copy an existing auto trace definition code to another property.

OperationId:copyAutoTraceDefinitions

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: autoTraceDefinitionCopy
parameters.description: Request object for copying trace definition.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

get.description:
Retrieve all configured Activity types for a specified hotel.

OperationId:getActivityTypes

The maximum allowable limit for this API is 25.

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description for the activity type is to be searched for.

parameters.name: inactive
parameters.description: Determines whether to fetch inactive records or not.

200.description: Response object after fetching the activity types.

post.summary: Create a new Activity type in configuration
post.description:
Create a new Activity Type for a specified hotel. Examples could be MEETING, LUNCH, EXTMEETING.

OperationId:postActivityTypes

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: activityTypesConfigInfo
parameters.description: Request object for creating activity types.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

delete.description:
This will delete an Activity Type Code from the properties configuration.

OperationId:deleteActivityTypes

parameters.name: activityTypeCode
parameters.description: Activity Type Code.

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

200.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

put.description:
Change or update details of an existing Activity Type for a property.

OperationId:putActivityTypes

parameters.name: activityTypeCode
parameters.description: Activity Type Code.

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: activityTypesConfigInfo
parameters.description: Request object for changing activity types.

get.summary: Get a list of Auto Trace definition Codes
get.description:
Get a list of all Auto trace definitions for a property.

OperationId:getAutoTraceDefinitions

The maximum allowable limit for this API is 25.

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

parameters.name: autoTraceGroups
parameters.description: A collection of supported list of Auto Trace Groups.

parameters.name: inactive
parameters.description: Determines whether to fetch inactive records or not.

200.description: Response object after fetching Auto Trace Definitions.

post.summary: Create an Auto Trace Definition Code
post.description:
Create a new Auto Trace Definition code for a specified property.

OperationId:postAutoTraceDefinitions

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: autoTraceDefinitionsInfo
parameters.description: Request object for creating Auto Trace Definitions.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

put.summary: Change an Auto Trace definition Code
put.description:
Change an Auto Trace Definition code for a specified property.

OperationId:putAutoTraceDefinitions

parameters.name: autoTraceDefinitionId
parameters.description: Unique ID of trace.

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: autoTraceDefinitionsInfo
parameters.description: Request object for changing Auto Trace Definitions.

get.summary: Get an Auto Trace owner mappings
get.description:
This API will provide a list of all configured Auto Trace Owner Mappings.

OperationId:getAutoTraceOwnerAssignments

The maximum allowable limit for this API is 25.

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

200.description: Response object to fetch trace owner assignments.

post.summary: Create an Auto Trace owner assignment
post.description:
You can create Auto traces so that activities are created automatically under certain configured conditions. You first need a Trace code configured, and then using this API you can link the Owner code and Trace Code to a Trace Group (account, contact, activity, or block).

OperationId:postAutoTraceOwnerAssignments

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: autoTraceOwnerAssignmentsInfo
parameters.description: Request object for creating trace owner assignments.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

put.description:
Change a Trace owner assignment configured for a property.

OperationId:putAutoTraceOwnerAssignments

parameters.name: autoTraceOwnerAssignmentID
parameters.description: Unique ID of trace owner.

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of hotel.

parameters.name: autoTraceOwnerAssignmentsInfo
parameters.description: Request object for changing trace owner assignments.

authKey.name: authorization
authKey.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication

x-hotelid.name: x-hotelid
x-hotelid.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the end user is logged in

x-hubid.name: x-hubid
x-hubid.description: x-hubid is a logical grouping of multiple properties that allows api consumers to manage data from a group of properties. This x-hubid is a valid list of hub codes configured in OPERA to which the user has access. Rest APIs without hotelId in the operation path can support hub level integration using x-hubid

activityResultsConfigDetails.description: Response object for fetching configured Activity Results.

totalPages.description: Evaluated total page count based on the requested max fetch count.

offset.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

limit.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

hasMore.description: Indicates whether all the records are included in the response or not. Absence of the attribute values should be consider as all rows fetched in the response.

inactive.description: Indicates the Activity Results is inactive or not.

translationTextType2000.description: Contains Multiple translated texts and language codes.

defaultText.description: Default text with Character length from 0 to 2000.

translatedTexts.description: List of translated text and language codes.

value.description: Used for Character Strings, length 0 to 2000.

instanceLink.description: Metadata describing link description objects that MAY appear in the JSON instance representation.

href.description: URI [RFC3986] or URI Template [RFC6570]. If the value is set to URI Template, then the "templated" property must be set to true.

rel.description: Name of the link relation that, in addition to the type property, can be used to retrieve link details. For example, href or profile.

templated.description: Boolean flag that specifies that "href" property is a URI or URI Template. If the property is a URI template, set this value to true. By default, this value is false.

method.description: HTTP method for requesting the target of the link.

targetSchema.description: Link to the metadata of the resource, such as JSON-schema, that describes the resource expected when dereferencing the target resource..

operationId.description: The operationId of the path you can call to follow this link.  This allows you to look up not only the path and method, but the description of that path and any parameters you need to supply.

title.description: Exact copy of the "summary" field on the linked operation.

warningsType.description: Used in conjunction with the Success element to define a business error.

warningType.description: Used when a message has been successfully processed to report any warnings or business errors that occurred.

shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings.

docURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the ErrorRS, (NotProcessed Incomplete Complete Unknown) however, the data type is designated as string data, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

recordId.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

type.description: The Warning element MUST contain the Type attribute that uses a recommended set of values to indicate the warning type. The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has NOT been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type ="Unknown".

rph.description: Reference Place Holder used as an index for this warning.

exceptionDetailType.title: Error Detail
exceptionDetailType.description: Complex type that contains error details for a REST call.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

o:errorDetails.description: Details of the error message, consisting of a hierarchical tree structure.

errorInstance.title: Error Instance Details
errorInstance.description: Complex type that contains error instance details for a REST call.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

allowOwnerAssignmentsCopy.description: When true, this will copy the owner assignments to the trace definition.

uniqueIDListType.description: Unique Id that references an object uniquely in the system.

uniqueID_Type.description: An identifier used to uniquely reference an object in a system (e.g. an airline reservation reference, customer profile reference, booking confirmation number, or a reference to a previous availability quote).

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

activityTypesConfigDetails.description: Response object after fetching the activity types.

totalPages.description: Evaluated total page count based on the requested max fetch count.

offset.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

hasMore.description: Indicates whether all the records are included in the response or not. Absence of the attribute values should be consider as all rows fetched in the response.

activityClassList.description: Element to hold Activity Class value.

internal.description: Check for whether to consider the activity type is internal.

sequence.description: Display sequence for the activity code type.

autoiCalendar.description: To create an iCal file (.ics) automatically and send it to the email address of the activity owner on activity creation, update, and deletion.

minutesBeforeAlert.description: Defines the number of minutes before the start time of an activity of this activity type, an alert should be issued.

inactive.description: When checked,the activity type will still be valid for existing activities and traces,but it cannot be selected for new activities and traces

hotelId.description: The hotel code where the activity type to be created.

hotelId.description: The hotel code where the Auto Trace should be created.

autoTraceTrigger.description: Element to hold information on when auto trace would be created.

fieldNameOnUpdate.description: Element to hold column name of relavant table on selection of Update in AutoTraceTriggerCategoryType.

fieldNameOnUpdateId.description: Element to hold column ID of relavant table on selection of Update in AutoTraceTriggerCategoryType.

autoTraceId.description: An identifier used to uniquely reference an object in a system (e.g. an airline reservation reference, customer profile reference, booking confirmation number, or a reference to a previous availability quote).

url.description: URL that identifies the location associated with the record identified by the UniqueID.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

instance.description: The identification of a record as it exists at a point in time. An instance is used in update messages where the sender must assure the server that the update sent refers to the most recent modification level of the object being updated.

idContext.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

idExtension.description: Additional identifying value assigned by the creating system.

autoTraceBlockCategoryType.description: Additional Block information used to trigger activities.

autoTraceTriggerCategoryType.description: Contains information on when auto trace would be created.

autoTraceDefinitionActivityInfoType.description: Activity Related Information of Auto Trace.

activityStartDate.description: Start Date of the Activity.Input for this field is selected from the list.

daysFromActivityStartDate.description: Number of days from activity start date

ownerCode.description: Owner code of trace owner assignment.

tags.name: ActivityManagement
tags.description: The Activity Configuration APIs offers capability of creating, managing, and retrieving Activity configuration elements, such as Activity Type code, Activity Result codes.

externalDocs.description: Find out more about Oracle Hospitality
